Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Is the applicant inadmissible under subsection 34(1)(f) due to membership in an organization engaging in subversion by force?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant admitted membership in the CLA, which engaged in armed attacks against Namibia's government. Her involvement was minimal and she claimed lack of knowledge.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Applicant seeking entry or status in Canada
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Membership in an organization reasonably believed to engage in subversion by force
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonable grounds to believe organization engaged in subversion by force
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nature and extent of membership, knowledge, and organizational activities
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of reasons provided by the Board
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Admission of CLA membership, documentation of CLA’s activities
Crimes.Application_Basis: Membership alone sufficient regardless of level of involvement
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Applicant's admission and public record on CLA
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Under IRPA s. 34(1)(f), membership in a subversive organization leads to inadmissibility
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration Division or equivalent administrative board
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential risk to national interest through association
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant's membership in CLA, an organization involved in subversive activities
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Relied on applicant’s admission and established facts about CLA
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: N/A – issue of admissibility, not compliance
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of immigration board under federal law
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Sufficient based on admission and public records
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Membership alone triggers inadmissibility under the law

Crimes.Crime_Name: Being a member of an organization that there are reasonable grounds to believe has engaged in an act of subversion against any government by force
Crimes.National_Security_Element: Association with an organization engaged in armed subversion
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Potential threat through affiliation with subversive group
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Risk posed by individuals linked to violent anti-government organizations
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Membership in CLA despite minimal role
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Armed attacks and subversion against Namibian government
Crimes.Organization_Involved: CLA (Congress of Democrats / armed liberation movement)
Crimes.Nature_of_Membership: General membership, no leadership or operational role
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Admission of membership, public records on CLA activities
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Relevance of applicant’s knowledge and level of involvement
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Consistency of testimony and lack of contradiction
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonable grounds to believe organization engaged in subversion by force
Crimes.Decision_Level: First-level adjudication with right to judicial review
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Found applicant inadmissible based on membership
Crimes.Process: Administrative determination followed by judicial review
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Right to present evidence and reasons provided by Board
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Sufficiency and clarity of Board’s reasoning
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness of Board’s interpretation and application of law
